intro: Jacksonia vernicosa, commonly known as the silverleaf daisy, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is characterized by its silvery, velvety leaves and bright yellow daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy or gravelly soils. It is part of the Asteraceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with composite flower heads. Jacksonia vernicosa is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
